1.  update to a more recent AspectJ rather than 1.5.2

Thanks for your comments and here is my reply:
1. the same error encountered in AJDT 1.4.1 (using AspectJ 1.5.3) for Eclipse 3.2 (20061123);
2. here is the code that can be compiled in java project but not in aj project:

public abstract class AbstractNode
<
   Id       extends Comparable<Id>,
   Np       extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, Np, Nt>,
   Nt       extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, Nt, Np>,
   SelfNode extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, SelfNode, DualNode>,
   DualNode extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, DualNode, SelfNode>
>
{
}

(In reply to comment #1)

Thanks for your comments and here is my reply:

1. the same error encountered in AJDT 1.4.1 (using AspectJ 1.5.3) for Eclipse
3.2 (20061123);
2. here is the code that can be compiled in java project but not in aj project:

public abstract class AbstractNode
<
   Id       extends Comparable<Id>,
   Np       extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, Np, Nt>,
   Nt       extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, Nt, Np>,
   SelfNode extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, SelfNode, DualNode>,
   DualNode extends AbstractNode<Id, Np, Nt, DualNode, SelfNode>
>
{
}

To make it more simpler, here is the code which is ok in java project but not in aj project:

public abstract class AbstractNode
<
   SelfNode extends AbstractNode<SelfNode, DualNode>,
   DualNode extends AbstractNode<DualNode, SelfNode>
>
{
}
tests and fix committed - will be in a dev build shortly.
